en: You have so much that you want to cover in your presentation pitch, but you're worried you won't be able to get to it all - and that it won't make much sense when you do.

As such, you're caught between writing a full script or using notecards as essential bullet points. A script might come off as robotic, but at least you'll know exactly what's happening. Meanwhile, there's always a chance you'll say something foolish  or misleading if you go off the cuff.
You write out a full script, tweaking sentences to achieve maximum impact. Now you just hope you'll be able to deliver it.
You make a handful of notecards, dotting them with the statistics and financials you'll need to remember. Now all takes is practice on the bits in between.
